dim.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: fairly dark or not giving much light, so that you cannot see well
dim.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: in the dim light of the early dawn
dim.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: a dim shape is one which is not easy to see because it is too far away, or there is not enough light
dim.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: The dim outline of a building loomed up out of the mist.
dim.translation[0].definitions[2].defini: dim eyes are weak and cannot see well
dim.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: Isaac was old and his eyes were dim.
dim.translation[0].definitions[3].defini: if your chances of success in the future are dim, they are not good
dim.translation[0].definitions[3].exampl: Prospects for an early settlement of the dispute are dim.
dim.translation[0].definitions[4].exampl: You can be really dim sometimes!
dim.translation[1].definitions[0].defini: if a light dims, or if you dim it, it becomes less bright
dim.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: The lights in the theatre began to dim.
dim.translation[1].definitions[1].defini: if a feeling, quality etc dims or is dimmed, it grows weaker or less
dim.translation[1].definitions[1].exampl: Even the rain could not dim their enthusiasm.
Hopes of a peaceful settlement have dimmed.
